titles.title: Veterans' Employment Transition Support Act of 2011
VETS Act of 2011
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow employers a credit against income tax for hiring veterans.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 2/17/2011--Introduced. Veterans' Employment Transition Support Act of 2011or the VETS Act of 2011- Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow employers a general business tax credit for hiring certain veterans certified by designated local agencies as having served on active duty (other than for training) in the Armed Forces for a period of more than 180 days or having been discharged or released from active duty for a service-connected disability. Sets the amount of such credit at 40% of the first-year wages of such veterans and increases the percentage of such credit for disabled veterans based upon their disability ratings.
